name: Above Ground Waterproofing Checklist
Substrate Acceptance
Application of Tremco 171 Primer or 200EC Primer
Application of Tremco 360NF to floor areas
Application of Tremco 350NFR to all upstands
Application of Tremco 951 top coat to entire area
Final Signoff by Danlaid, Tremco & Watpac
QA - Pour Checklist
Substrate
Inspection of Substrate
Ensure Water ingress has been reduced/redirected such that the Paraseal membrane will not be damaged during application Ensure area is free from voids and sharp edges.
All voids and sharp edges exceeding 50mm wide/25mm deep are to be patched
Ensure minimum concrete strength achieved (20mpa)
Ensure Tremco inspect the substrate with Watpac
Ensure all leaking anchors are patched by Delta Ensure Tremco Tremcrete is applied firmly in a 2:1 mix ratio to all patches and to all 90 degree junctions
Ensure Tremco Tremcrete is applied firmly in a 2:1 mix ratio to all patches and to all 90 degree junctions
Patch Defective Substrate Using Tremco Tremcrete
Final Check and Acceptance of Substrate
Application of Tremco Paraseal LG
Secure all penetrations prior to detailing.
Ensure waterstop installed to construction joints with minimum 50mm cover of concrete
Ensure minimum overlap of 200mm to Paraseal is achieved to both walls and floor
Walls: Ensure adequate fixings are applied to wall to secure Paraseal
For installation on walls, ensure Paraseal is applied HDPE side facing the wall and all horizontal seams facing upward
Ensure nails are applied every 600mm
Floor: For installation to floor, ensure Paraseal is applied HDPE side facing up
Ensure installation of Paraseal is as per supplied details and approved drawings
Ensure all seams are taped and using heat as required
Ensure Tremco Paraseal is installed as per approved DAN-ST-100 series & DAN-ST-200 series details
Ensure Paraterm is installed at each termination of membrane
Complete Installers Check List
Substrate has been prepared as per ITP
Paraseal membrane has been applied HDPE facing up. Sheets lapping a minimum of 150 mm and all seams taped.
Paraseal installed Bentonite facing outward with pins every 600mm, Minimum laps of 150 mm and free of any voids.
Lower Sheets to lap Infront of the sheet above on walls
Water stop has been installed each pour break and at the transition from floor to walls.
Paraseal lapped up the pile and fixed with permanent seam tape. Paraseal fixed in place using cable tie or steel clamp.
Ensure Paraterm bar is installed along the edge of completed works (pressure seal ribs facing down) and all exposed edges are taped.
Photos of completed works taken prior to commencing Paraseal application
Small cuts and holes in the membrane have been repaired using Paraseal Paramastic or as prescribed by Tremco.
Damaged sheets have been repaired using additional tape, patched with Paraseal, or replaced per Tremco procedure.
Photos of works taken prior to commencing Paraseal application
Complete Final Inspection and Sign Off with Tremco and Watpac
Identify Defective Areas
Mark out Defective Areas on Basement Waterproofing Defect Checklist
Upload Photo to Each Repair Undertaken
Danlaid, Tremco and Watpac to Sign Off as Area Completed

Warnings: Not allowed as a child of checklist-sectioned.
